summary: Payments: ErgoPay and web dApp connectors serve similar purposes but have key differences. ErgoPay can connect any wallet with any dApp, while a web dApp connector is limited to web extension wallets and website dApps. As a dApp developer, you may need to run part of your logic on a server that can be accessed by user's wallet applications, which doesn't necessarily complicate things as you can choose the language and framework that best suits your needs.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main difference between ErgoPay and web dApp connectors?
qa_pairs.answer: ErgoPay can connect any wallet with any dApp, while a web dApp connector is limited to web extension wallets and website dApps.

qa_pairs.question: What is the limitation of a web dApp connector?
qa_pairs.answer: A web dApp connector can only connect processes living in the same web browser.

qa_pairs.question: Why must a dApp developer run part of their logic on a server?
qa_pairs.answer: Because the dApp developer may not know which type of wallet application will connect to their dApp.

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of running some code on the backend for a website dApp?
qa_pairs.answer: On the backend, the dApp developer is not restricted to using JavaScript or its derivatives and can choose the language and framework that best suits their needs.

qa_pairs.question: Does running code on the backend necessarily complicate things for the dApp developer?
qa_pairs.answer: No, running some code on the backend does not necessarily complicate things for the dApp developer.

sections.heading: Payments
sections.content:
ErgoPay and the web dApp connectors that Nautilus uses serve similar purposes but have key differences. ErgoPay can connect any wallet with any dApp, while a web dApp connector is limited to web extension wallets and website dApps. It can only connect processes living in the same web browser.

As a dApp developer, you may not know which type of wallet application will connect to your dApp. Therefore, a part of your logic must run on a server that can be accessed by user’s wallet applications. For a website dApp, this means that some of your code needs to live on your backend. This doesn’t necessarily complicate things. In fact, on the backend, you aren’t restricted to using JavaScript or its derivatives. You are free to choose the language and framework that best suits your needs.
